com.nitnelave.xmlparser

Class XMLParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nitnelave.xmlparser.XMLParser

  • public class XMLParser
extends java.lang.Object

    Generic XML SAX parser. This class handles the registration of XMLNodes and listeners, and takes care of the actual parsing.

    Author:
    nitnelave
    See Also:
    XMLProperty, XMLNode

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      XMLParser() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void parse(java.io.InputStream in)
      Start parsing, taking the input from the stream given.
      void registerListener(java.lang.Object handler)
      Register a listener.
      void registerNodes(java.lang.Class<?>... nodes)
      Register classes that describe XML Nodes.
      If the classes do not have the @XMLNode annotation, or there is a required method missing, an XMLStructureException will be raised.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public XMLParser()

    • Method Detail

      • parse

        public void parse(java.io.InputStream in)
           throws org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                  java.io.IOException,
                  javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException
        Start parsing, taking the input from the stream given.
        Parameters:
        in - The stream to read from
        Throws:
        org.xml.sax.SAXException - parsing error; see SAXParser documentation
        javax.xml.parsers.ParserConfigurationException - see SAXParser documentation
        java.io.IOException - if there is a IO error

      • registerListener

        public void registerListener(java.lang.Object handler)
                      throws XMLStructureException
        Register a listener. The class will be inspected for compatible methods.
        Make sure to register all the node before registering handlers;
        Parameters:
        handler - the handler class, with the appropriate methods
        Throws:
        XMLStructureException - if there is no root node defined

      • registerNodes

        public void registerNodes(java.lang.Class<?>... nodes)
                   throws XMLStructureException
        Register classes that describe XML Nodes.
        If the classes do not have the @XMLNode annotation, or there is a required method missing, an XMLStructureException will be raised.
        Parameters:
        nodes - The list of classes to be registered as xml nodes
        Throws:
        XMLStructureException - if there is an architecture problem.
        See Also:
        XMLStructureException
